info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 8 at 4:54AM EDT until April 8 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Peachtree City GA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia...
Falling Creek near Juliette affecting Jones County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Falling Creek near Juliette.
* WHEN...Until this afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 13 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding begins in the woodlands and natural flood plain along the creek in the Piedmont National Wildlife Refuge upstream and downstream from the gage on Round Oak-Juliette Road.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 13.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:45 AM EDT Tuesday was 14 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this morning and continue falling to 6.9 feet this evening. - Flood stage is 13 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON
